note.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that you write down to remind you of something
note.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
Keep a careful note of any problems you have with the software.
note.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to decide that you must remember to do something later
note.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He made a mental note to arrange a time to meet her.
note.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
This is just a quick note to let you know that I won’t be in the office tomorrow.
a suicide note (=a note telling someone that you are going to kill yourself)
a thank you note (=a note to say thank you for something)
diplomatic note (=a formal letter from one government to another)
note.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a short piece of writing at the bottom of a page or at the end of a book or document which gives more information about something written in the main part
note.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The notes are at the back of the book.
A set of guidance notes is provided to assist applicants in completing the form.
note.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a particular musical sound, or a symbol representing this sound
note.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: She has a good voice but has trouble hitting the high notes.
note.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a piece of paper money worth a particular amount of money
note.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a type of feeling or quality when someone speaks or does something
note.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: There was a note of doubt in her voice.
He brought a note of realism into the debate.
She ended her speech on a personal note.
On a more serious note, I’d like to thank everyone for all their support.
note.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: As he read the letters, he made careful notes.
The reporter took notes throughout the interview.
The jurors were scribbling notes as the witness gave evidence.
It’s a good idea to write up your notes soon after a lecture.
I read through my notes before the exam.
I always make quite detailed notes after important meetings.
She sat at the back of the hall and made copious notes.
He jotted down some brief notes.
Her rather scrappy notes weren’t much use when it came to revision.
I missed class today; can I borrow your lecture notes?
The researchers looked at the case notes of 500 patients with this type of cancer.
I asked if I could see my medical notes.
note.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to notice or pay careful attention to something
note.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He carefully noted the time when they left the building.
It should be noted that parking without a permit attracts a charge of £5.
Please note that the bill must be paid within ten days.
Note how she is holding her racket.
note.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to mention something because it is important or interesting
note.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The judge noted that Miller had no previous criminal record.
note.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a piece of printed paper that is used as money
note.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a short letter or official document
note.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: a note from the chief executive
note.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: used in the names of bonds or COMMERCIAL PAPER (=borrowing for less than a year by companies)
note.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The government has auctioned $15 billion of three-year notes (=borrowing that will be repaid after three years).
note.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to mention something important or interesting so that people will notice it
note.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: ‘The big stores aren’t competing for space any more, ’ notes Davidowitz.
Analysts note that unless the discount rate is lowered, a substantial stock market recovery isn’t likely.
note.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to notice or pay careful attention to something
note.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Please note the following amendments to the guidelines.
Investors should note that these new long-term options are currently quite a risk.
It’s worth noting that there’s now little real price differential between the two types of product.
